newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-CAMP NOU GRAFITTI TELLS ROBSON TO 'GO HOME'.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-CAMP NOU GRAFITTI TELLS ROBSON TO 'GO HOME'.

text.p: Barcelona employees have had had to whitewash over grafitti aimed at Barcelona manager Bobby Robson and the club board on the walls of the Camp Nou stadium.
"Robson go home," read a comment written in English. The former England coach was also advised to go to an old people's home, and compared to Barcelona zoo's famous albino gorilla 'Snowflake'.
"More Catalans and less trash," said another piece of the graffiti.
It followed a week in which Barcelona president Jose Luis Nunez openly criticised defender Albert Ferrer for announcing that he had been approached by arch-rivals Real Madrid.
Ferrer had complained that the club was paying foreign players more than those who had come up through the reserve teams.
The arrival of numerous foreigners at Camp Nou has led to the exclusion of local players such as Ferrer, midfielder Albert Celades and brothers Oscar and Roger Garcia.
